defs: abounding or covered with, water ; marshy.
= ಅನೂಪದೇಶ.
a tract of low, wet, soft land that is temporarily or permanently, covered with water, characterised by aquatic, grass-like vegetation; marshy land.
a stretch of rising land on either side of a river.
a steep rise or slope, as of a hill.
a natural or artificial pool or pond used for water storage.
domesticated wild bovid, as the water buffalo of India; a buffalo.
a tailless, leaping amphibian with long, powerful hind legs, short forelegs, a smooth skin, and webbed feet; a frog.
thick-skinned, almost hairless mammal, the largest of extant four-footed animals, with a long, flexible trunk; an elephant.
a kind of partridge.
a place having good water source.
= ಅನೂರಾಧೆ.
a bright star in the constellation Scorpio; the seventeenth of twenty seven star, in Indian astrology.
a man without thighs.
(myth.) the driver of the Sun-God's Chariot.
without legal force; not binding; invalid; null; void.
to make no longer binding under the law; to quash; to annul.
the fact or condition of being invalid and ineffective under the law; the process of making so.
a land which is not salty, and conducive for agriculture.
not imaginable or comprehensible; unimaginable; incomprehensible.
the quality or fact, of being unimaginable; unimaginableness.
not straight; crooked.
acting with fraud; deceitful; fraudulent.
a deceitful man; a fraud.
the innate disposition or inherent tendency of a man to deceive others.
free from debt; owing nothing; debtless.
not owing gratitude; not being under moral obligation.
one who owes to another - a) any debt or b) any moral obligations.
that which is not true; a statement, etc. that does not accord with fact or reality; the condition or quality of being false; falsehood.
work of cultivating the soil, producing required crops; agriculture.
a statement in contradiction of the fact; a false declaration or assertion made with an intention to deceiving.
one who makes such a statement, declaration or assertion; a liar.
a person contending in magical arts.
till; upto (certain time).
= ಅನೇಕ1.
many - a) consisting of some large, indefinite number (of persons or things); numerous; b) relatively numerous.
a large number (of persons or things); many.
that which has more than one tongue; a snake.
2.Ādiśeṣa, the serpent-king who has many hoods and tongues.
differing one from another; of several kinds; various.
(phil.) the theory that reality is composed of a multiplicity of ultimate beings, principles or substances; the philosophy that recognises more than one principle of being; pluralism.
one who advocates the philosophy of pluralism; pluralist.
the state of being plural; the state of being numerous; the quality or condition of being manifold or various; plurality; multiplicity.
= ಅನೇಕತೆ.
= ಅನೇಕತಾವಾದ.
= ಅನೇಕತಾವಾದಿ.
the elephant, which drinks water in more than one ( = two) stages.
having numerous stands and postures.
many births of the same soul.
having many faces.
having talents in more than one way; multi-faceted.
(in pl.) various types or kinds.
(gram.) number that refers to more than one person or thing; plural number.
= ಅನೇಕವೇಳೆ.
more than one type or kind; several types, sorts, variety or class.
several times; repeating or recurring more than once.
that which is not meant only for one person; that which is not confidential.
(Jain.) a logical reasoning taking into consideration all aspects of the subject of argument.
(Jain.) a comprehensiveness of reasoning, taking all aspects of the subject matter into consideration.
a logical reasoning considering all the aspects of all the subject matter.
a many-lettered foot of a stanza in a poem.
(masc.) one who has masterly ability in several branches of knowledge.
a verbal root having more letters than one.
having many ends or tips.
(of mind) thinking of or contemplating on many issues or subjects at a time.
the quality or fact of having many branches, tips, etc. (as a tree).
divergence of mind's process in contemplation or analysis; lack of ability to concentrate.
of different kinds; various; including or involving many subjects, interests, etc.
that which has more meanings than one.
several times; repeating or recurring more than once.
= ಅನೇಕಾವರ್ತಿ.
the belief or doctrine that there are more than one God.
one who believes or advocates ಅನೇಕೇಶ್ವರವಾದ.
(pl.) several statements.
(gram.) number that refers to more than one person or thing; plural number.
not desirous of the benefits, fruits of one's effort.
a deaf and dumb man.
a blind man.
a person who defrauds, deceives or tricks others; a cheat.
lack of unity; disunity.
attempting to do or think on many things at a time; having diversified ends, aims; lacking concentration.
a person lacking concentration.
(log.) one of the five fallacies of argument, i.e. the argument being too general or not general enough or inconclusive.
not united; disunited; separated.
want of unity; a breaking up of union or concord; disunion; disintegration.
that is not optional; that must be done, undergone, etc.; obligatory; required; compulsory.
involuntary - a) not done of one's own free will; not done by choice; b) unintentional; accidental; c) not consciously controlled; automatic.
the condition of doing something against one's will.
condition of (something) happening without conscious effort or control of the doer; involuntariness.
inability to control urination; esp., involuntary bed-wetting ; incontinence of urine; enuresis.
not in conformity with accepted principles of right and wrong behaviour; immoral; unethical.
sexual intercourse with someone to whom one is not married.
the quality or state of being immoral or unethical; immorality.
a speech that is unsuitable for the purpose; a wrong, foolish, awkward or clumsy inept talking.
lack of cleanliness and sanitariness.

not natural; unnatural; esp. a) contrary to or at variance with, nature; b) artificial, affected or strained; c) characterised by a lack of the emotions, attitudes or behaviour regarded as natural, normal or right; perverted.
the quality or fact of being abnormal or unnatural; unnaturalness.
an old measure of quantity; (properly: ಅಯ್ಗೊಳ).
having no residence; shelterless; homeless.
a perennial plant with one main stem or trunk which develops many branches, usu. at some height above the ground; a tree.
lack of a) strength, energy; b) splendour or lustre.
dull and ordinary composition, lacking the poetic force, brilliance, and imagination.
(Jain.) one of the four stages of ಸಂಸಾರ (all that concerning, influencing the living of a soul in its each birth), in which the soul reaches the absoluteness; the abode of Jina.
the condition or fact of not being suitable or unfit for the purpose; ineptness; inappropriateness; impropriety.
the nature or habit of not parting with money, food etc.; unwillingness to help or oblige.
not formal; not according to prescribed or fixed customs, rules, ceremonies, etc.; informal.
absence of formalities; the quality or state of being informal.
that which is not planned for, not prepared, not made ready beforehand.
the quality of being incomparable; matchlessness; uniqueness; incomparability.
not having, pertaining to, attributes or properties; unconditional.
the state, quality or fact of being not having attributes or properties.
(law) born of parents not married to each other; not in the legal position of those in wed locked or legitimised; illegitimate.
the child born of parents not married to each other.
(law) an offspring not recognised as lawful offspring.
of that type, character or nature.
(gen.) that which is taken into and assimilated by human beings to keep them alive and enable them to grow and repair tissue; food.
cooked rice, as the staple food.
Viṣṇu one of the Hindu Trinities.
the sun or the Sun-God.
water.
the earth.

ಅನ್ನ ಕಟ್ಟು anna kaṭṭu (fig.) to spend less on food and other essential needs with a view to saving money for future or for a particular purpose; ಅನ್ನ ಕಸಿ(ದುಕೊ) anna kasi(duko) = ಅನ್ನ ಕಿತ್ತುಕೊ; ಅನ್ನ ಕಿತ್ತುಕೊ anna kittuko (fig.) to spoil one's means of subsistence; ಅನ್ನಕ್ಕೆ ಕಲ್ಲು ಹಾಕು annakke kallu hāku = ಅನ್ನ ಕಿತ್ತುಕೊ; ಅನ್ನಕ್ಕೆ ದಂಡ, ಭೂಮಿಗೆ ಭಾರ annakke daṇḍa, bhūmige bhāra (prov.) (said of) a completely useless person; ಅನ್ನಕ್ಕೆ ಬಿದ್ದಿರು annakke biddiru (derog.) to depend entirely (often helplessly) on another for one's basic necessities; ಅನ್ನಕ್ಕೆ ತತ್ವಾರವಾಗು annakke tatvāravāgu (one's condition) to become worse as to have no means for subsistence; ಅನ್ನ ಗಂಜಿಯಾಗು anna gañjiyāgu (id .) to become extremely poor, destitute; (ಒಬ್ಬನ) ಅನ್ನ ತಿಂದಿರು (obbana) a nna tindiru (fig.) to be under the obligation of another from whom a help (esp. as an employee) is received; ಅನ್ನದ ಗೊಂಬೆ annada gombe (dial.) a small jointed figure made of boiled rice waved three times before a child and thrown out which ritual is believed to ward off evil spirits or cure diseases; ಅನ್ನದಲ್ಲಿ ಕಲ್ಲನ್ನು ಜಗಿದಂತಾಗು annadalli kallannu jagidaŋgāgu (simile) to encounter unexpectedly a condition of grief or great inconvenience, embarrassment; ಅನ್ನಕೇಳಬೇಡ, ಅರಿವೆ ಕೇಳಬೇಡ, ಅರಗಿಣಿಯ ಹಾಗೆ ಸಾಕುತ್ತೇನೆ anna kēḷabēḍa, arive kēḷabēḍa, aragiṇiya hāge sākuttēne (prov.) if I do not have to spend from my pocket, let the guardianship be mine; ಅನ್ನದ ದಾರಿ annada dāri (fig.) a means of one's livelihood; ಅನ್ನದ ಬಾಯಿಗೆ ಮಣ್ಣುಹಾಕು annada bāyige maṇṇu hāku = ಅನ್ನ ಕಿತ್ತುಕೊ; ಅನ್ನಹಾಕಿದ ಕೈ ಕಚ್ಚು anna hākida kai kaccu = ಅನ್ನ ಹಾಕಿದ ಮನೆಗೆ ಕನ್ನ ಹಾಕು ; ಅನ್ನ ಹಾಕಿದ ಮನೆಗೆ ಕನ್ನ ಹಾಕು anna hākida manege kanna hāku (fig.) to be ungrateful to one from whom timely help was received; to betray the one who helped at time of difficulty; ಅನ್ನ ಹಳಸಿತ್ತು ನಾಯಿ ಕಾದಿತ್ತು anna haḷasittu, nāyi kādittu worst thing goes to the one who does not deserve a better.
= ? (ಅನ್ನವೇ ನಿಜವೆಂಬುದರ್ಥ).
up to the time of; till; until.
the moral obligation of being loyal to another for the livelihood got from him.
(in comp.) a man of that sort, quality or nature.
by that time or period; before the end of that period.
upto that time; till then.
like that; in that manner.
to get, to have, food; to earn one's livelihood.
by that time or period; before the end of that period.
upto that time; till then.

upto that distance or time.
by that time; by them.
upto a short period.
depriving or havingthe tendency to deprive another of means of livelihood.
one who spoils another's means of livelihood.
the quality of person who spoils another's means of livelihood.
= ಅನ್ನಕಂ.
one who provides food or employment.
= ಅನ್ನಕಂ.
= ಅನ್ನಕಂ.
of or related to food; caused or affected, by food.
a person who cannot endure hunger.

(dial.) one who lies for food.
act of taking food.
a place where food is served free of cost (esp. to wayfarers) on charity.

food-born; food related; caused by food.
= ಅನ್ನದಾತ.
a pouring of cooked rice on a deity, (as a part of worship).
the philanthropic donor of food.
a food-provider; an employer.
the act of donating food; food-donation.
a person giving food charitably.
a thing of that type, sort or quality.
lack of gratitude for favours received in terms of food or livelihood.
a feeling of not liking or distaste for food; an aversion for food.
a man of that sort, type or manner.
the tube leading from the mouth to the stomach; the tube through which food passes to the stomach; the oesophagus.
= ಅನ್ನಪಾನ.
a variety in swan.
= ಅನ್ನಪಚನೆ.
act or process of cooking food.
the process of digestion of food in the stomach.
(dial.) community dinner arranged for Vīraśaiva mendicants.
a giving of food in place of wages for the work done.
(pl.) boiled rice and side dish served along with it.
(pl.) food and water (i.e. all these food items that are required for survival).
the Hindu Goddess presiding the food; the food-providing deity.
a woman generous in giving food.
the process and the ceremony of feeding the child solid water for the first time.
upto that point of time.
by that time; by then.

a green, crystalline compound, FeSO47H2O, used in dyeing, in the manufacture of ink, etc.; ferrous sulfate; copperas.
the arrogance due to self-sufficiency in one's means of livelihood.
in mysticism, one of the five sheaths that cover the soul; the material sheath; the gross body.

the presiding deity of food.
= ಅನ್ನಪ್ರಾಶನ.
injustice i.e. a) the quality of being unjust or unfair; lack of justice; wrong; b) deprival of justice; c) an unjust act.
pl. of annan.

the essential part of boiled rice taken out by squeezing it in either soup or butter milk.
the thick, semi-fluid mass resulting from gastric digestion of food; the chyme.
= ಅನ್ನಬರ.
a religious vow of abandoning taking food; a fasting for religious purpose.
(pl.) food and clothes; the basic essentials for one's livelihood.
a room or a place, in a house, usu. where food is cooked or prepared; a kitchen.
a room in a house, where food is served; a dining room.
pl. of ಅನ್ನದು.
a propitiatory rite for averting evil by feeding guests plentifully.
a rite of making the food religiously pure and holy before having, by sprinkling ghee and reciting hymns.
ghee used to purify the food.
a formal act, established by custom, of offering of cooked food (esp. cooked rice, dhal etc.) to the manes as annual ritual.
the service or ceremony at which such acts are performed.
a feeding of guests (esp. Brahmaṇas) with sumptuous food, with religious or social purpose.
the art, practice, process or work of cooking; cookery.
the process of religious purification of food served.
a resistance put up against another, esp. one in power, by wilfully abstaining from taking food, till the demands are met.
a place where food is served free of cost (esp. to wayfarers) on charity.
a woman of that sort, type or manner.
(Jain.) a divine tree that yields the desired food.

any of a number of unrelated, complex organic substances found variously in most foods or sometimes synthesised in the body, and essential, in small amounts, for the regulation of the metabolism and normal growth and functioning of the body; a vitamin.
the saviour of the poor and distressed.
one who takes boiled rice as food.
a man lacking even minimum means for subsistence; a very poor man.
the state of being very poor.
an acute shortage or lack, of food.
a pouring of cooked rice on a deity, (as a part of worship).
upto that point of time; so long as.
by that time; by then.

= ಅನ್ನಾರ.
one who is need of food; a person who begs or asks for food, esp. one who lives by begging; a beggar.
the large, saclike organ of vertebrates into which food passes from the oesophagus or gullet for storage while undergoing the early processes of digestion; the stomach.
a row of persons sitting for having meals.
(masc.) one who is outside or not included; esp., one not a member of a group; an outsider.
(fem.) one who is outside or not included; esp., one not a member of a group; an outsider.
a loose, long cloth used as a cover for shoulders.
to cause to say or utter; to cause to reproach or abuse.
(something, as an emotion or condition) to be experienced; to feel.
(something) to be thought of or believed, often based on unanalysed or emotional reasons.
to get harsh words from another; to get accused of and blamed for a fault.
to say; to utter; to express in words.
to produce musical sounds or notes with the voice; to sing.
to give a name or title to; to name.
to express the meaning or sentiment, in detail.
to use harsh words; to blame or scold in a sharp way; to reprimand.

ಅಂದು ಆಡು andu āḍu to criticise severely; to censure; ಅನ್ನುವ ಹಾಗಿಲ್ಲ, ಅನುಭವಿಸುವ ಹಾಗಿಲ್ಲ annuva hāgilla, anubhavisuva hāgilla such a fact, situation or plight that can neither be brought to another's notice, nor be endured.
wrong spelling for ಅನುಮಾನ.
a woman of that sort or character.
(masc.) one who does injustice, commits wrong to others.

till; upto (certain time).
under that circumstance; that being so.
to that extent; upto to that level.
by that time; by then; in or during the intervening time; meantime.

not the same; distinct; separate; other; different; another.
= ಅನ್ಯಕ.
that (a thing) which is different; another thing.
another or a different man.
a person who causes to happen.
a man who metes out injustice to another.
the mind lacking concentration or that which cannot concentrate on a single object.
a man who is born in another clan, caste or race.
a caste other than the one being referred; a different caste.
(biol.) a different family, genus or order.
one of the two (things, men).
the state of being - a) separate; b) different; separation; disunion.
at a different place; in or to some other place; somewhere else; elsewhere.
in a different situation or under a different circumstance.
the state of being present elsewhere.
(law) the defensive plea or fact that an accused person was elsewhere than at the scene of the crime with which the person is charged; alibi.
(psych.) of or pertaining to ideas that originate independently of normal modes of thought or influences, as an obsession of schizophrenic construct; autochthonous.
(psych.) the condition of being autochthonous; autochthonism.
the state or fact of being different or having a separate identity.
(phil.) the theory that the soul is different from the gross body it is embodied in.
(Jain.) pondering or meditating on a particular (one of the twelve) principles for attaining the beatitude.
(Jain.) the view or theory, that the soul is different from the gross body which it is housed in.
a different thing; another thing.
of or belonging to another.
differently; in a different way.
the feeling of being different.
a wrong conception; a mis-conception.
(log.) the theory that all that is seen or perceived need not be the fact or truth.
a person who perceives an object differently; one who has a false conception not in accord with the facts.
the inevitable way, resort (turned to for help, support etc); a choiceless option.
a living in a different or unusual, way.
established or proved, in a different way or based on a different proof.

(log.) (in an argument) a fallacy of attributing the cause to a different object or event (other than the evident ones readily available), which has no direct connection with or bearing on, the effect.
one who worships a deity in a way different from the usual or accepted one.
the act or process of worshipping a deity in an unusual way.
a woman married to another (not one's wife).
a man not indulging in unlawful sexual activity with a woman other than his wife; a virtuous man.
a mental viewing, a vision, which is different and unusual.
foreign - a) situated outside one's own country, province, locality, etc; b) of, from or characteristic of another country or countries; c) produced, made in a different country.
a person from another country, thought of as an outsider; alien; a foreigner.
= ಅನ್ಯದೇಶೀಯ1.
a word, not originally belonging to a language other than the one it is being used in (usu. not cognate).
a deity other than the one being worshipped by a person; another's deity.
another's religion; any religion that is different from one's.
the king of another country.
a king hostile or wartime adversary to another.
a woman not being one's wife.

the transfer of pollen from the anther of one flower to the stigma of another with a different genetic composition, as by the action of wind or insects or deliberately by a botanist; cross-pollination.
the act, process or fact, of breaking down or humiliating others.
the food prepared or cooked by another (as dif. from the one made by oneself).
(said with reference to a woman) a man other than one's husband.
(gram.) a person other than the speaker and the one addressed; the third person.
living on or in an organism of another species for sustenance or protection without benefit to, and usually with harmful effects on, the host.
any of various large cuckoos (genus Eudynamys) of India, hatched and reared by crows; the koel.
the status of a woman who had pre-marital sexual relations with a man (other than the one she married later).
a woman who had sexual relations with a man before her marriage.
another birth; the life other than the present one.
a different opinion.
(dial.) the opinion of another.
= ಅನ್ಯಪುಷ್ಟ1.
= ಅನ್ಯಪುಷ್ಟ2.
so dreamy or lost in thought as not to pay attention to what one is doing or what is going on around one; absent-minded.
a man who is absent-minded or habitually forgetful; an inattentive man.
the quality or state of being absent-minded; inattentiveness; absent-mindedness.
a woman who is absent-minded; an inattentive or forgetful woman.
a root different from the usual one.
a way, manner, course of action, habits of life or conduct or style, followed by another; (being essentially different from the one followed).
a person with different symbol or token.
a person belonging to another religion.
another maṇs wife; a woman other than one's wife.
a different colour.
in Hinduism, a different caste.
an advocate of another religion or philosophy.
the money, wealth belonging to another.
a taking away of another's or others' money, belonging or wealth unlawfully and by, force or fraud.
a subject or a matter for consideration, other than the one referred to or being considered at present.
a country other than one's own; a foreign country.
a country other than the one being referred to at the moment.
(geol.) a rock fragment different in origin and kind from the igneous rock in which it is embedded; xenolith.
a religion other than one's own.
a person belonging to or following, other religion.
situated or being at a different place.
a body of another person (as dif. from one's).
coital relation with a woman other than one's wife.
= ಅನ್ಯಾಂಗನಾರತಿ.
a woman other than one's wife; another's wife.
a mystical achievement, in which one can, in spirit, enter into another's body and act as the latter in his capacity.
the behaviour departed from or contrary to the existing law, custom, etc.; a wicked course of action.
of a different kind.
unusual; rare; exceptional.
(rhet.) a manner address, being addressed to a third person, but meant for the second person (a figure of speech).
injustice - a) the quality of being unjust or unfair; lack of justice; wrong; b) an unjust act; injury; wrong.

an unlawful act or behaviour.
earned or gained in an unlawful or immoral way.
one who violates law, cheats or metes injustice to others.

not having any defect; free from faults; defectless.
not having less quantity or number; having requisite numbers or quantity; full; complete.

mutual - a) done, felt, etc. by each of two or more for or toward the other or others; reciprocal; b) of or having the same relationship toward, each other or one another; c) shared in common; joint.
reciprocal and friendly feelings and relation between two persons.

a mutual quarrel or dispute.
the theory of reciprocity of cause and effect; reciprocity of causation.
reciprocal state or relationship; mutual action, dependence, etc.; reciprocity.

a mutual war between two persons or nations.
having mutually divergent (views, interests etc.).
spreading or extending on each other; having the tendency to grow, move or spread based on mutual relations.
= ಅನ್ಯೋನ್ಯಯುದ್ಧ.
a familiar, friendly and intimate conversation between two persons.
mutually touched or touching.
lack of intimate, friendly relations between two persons.
absence of any relation between two persons.
(log.) mutual non-existence or negation.
mutual bitter debate, fighting or quarrelling on contentious issues.
the fact, condition or quality of being depending mutually; dependence on each other or one another; mutual dependence; interdependence.
one of the two each of whom is depending mutually on the other.
depending mutually on the other.
= ಅನ್ಯೋನ್ಯಾವಲಂಬನೆ.
= ಅನ್ಯೋನ್ಯಾವಲಂಬಿತ.
(rhet.) a mutual comparison of two different objects, where one is likened to the other and conversely too.
= ಅನ್ಯೋನ್ಯೋಪಮಾನ.
the fact or instance of associating with another or others.
a respecting and appreciating of one's associates.
a country other than one's own or the one being referred to at the moment.
the king of a foreign country.
a king hostile or wartime adversary to another.
immediately after (following, happening etc.).
= ಅನ್ವಂಗಂ.
all those claiming descent from a common ancestor; tribe or clan; lineage; family.
a division of Jaina society.
(gram.) the syntactic relations of words in a sentence construction.
the agreement in feeling, action, ideas, interests, etc.; peaceable or friendly relations; harmony.
one who adjusts his actions, manners, and temperament to suit another's will or order.
meaning or explanatory note for the meaning, of a literary work.
a chain of consequences or deductions; consecution.
the act of applying or using; the act of putting something to use; application.
a way or method of applying or using.
the relationship of ancestors and descendants, in a chronological order, in a given family.
the order in which a verse is re-arranged to get the syntactic relations of words.
the end of a family, tribe or clan.
a man who brings his own family to an end.
a woman who brings an end to her own family.
(masc.) one who brings pride to his family.
(fem.) one who brings pride to her family.
(Jain.) transferring of one's wealth, and the effects of one's virtues to his own son or an adopted son with a view to making the lineage growing for ever.
endowment made for this purpose.
a man who brings light to, spreads the fame of, his family.
= ಅನ್ವಯಪ್ರದೀಪ.
a woman who brings light to, spreads the fame of, her family.
any branch of science put to actual use; applied science.
a propagating or incessant continuation, of the lineage of one's family.
the prosperity of a family.
(log.) the statement that one thing depends on the other for its existence and in the absence of the latter, it does not exist.
